intro: Pennellia, commonly known as the common pennellia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences, which resemble those of carrots and parsley. They are typically herbaceous perennials, often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Pennellia species are valued for their medicinal properties and are used in traditional herbal remedies. Their botanical features make them important in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
